executive_summary: This industry supplies prefabricated homes and various other construction materials to downstream markets, such as dealers, retailers and land developers. Wholesalers' revenue is therefore impacted by the broader downstream construction sector. During the COVID-19 pandemic, as interest rates were lowered, the housing market grew, enabling manufactured home wholesalers to tap into a consistent stream of demand. At the same time, construction activity benefited from high disposable income levels and elevated demand for housing. This trend essentially reversed itself since 2022, as the Federal Reserve has remained committed to raising interest rates to combat high inflation. Despite rising rates, industry revenue still rose at a CAGR of 1.5% to an estimated $35.9 billion in 2024, when revenue is set to rise 1.1% and profit has seen an overall decline.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Low Interest Rates Aided Wholesalers Amid the Pandemic
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Demand for construction materials from home improvement stores dipped in 2020 amid the COVID-19 pandemic. The need for tools and materials plummeted due to nationwide business shutdowns and job losses, directly affecting downstream markets. The COVID-19 pandemic drove down the value of private nonresidential construction due to reductions in demand for goods and construction services. The value of residential construction value grew in 2020 and 2021 as low interest rates promoted investment, some of which filtered up to industry wholesalers, who supply a wide range of construction materials.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: House wraps, vapor barriers and insulation products
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: House wraps, vapor barriers and insulation products account for a significant share of industry wholesalers' revenue; these products benefitted from rising housing starts and rising spending on home improvements during the COVID-19 pandemic. In spite of heightened interest rates, both of these metrics are still set to be above pre-pandemic levels through 2024.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Since 2022, inflationary pressure and rising interest rates have decreased the affordability of industry products. Surging home prices have also trickled down to manufactured homes, affecting market segments within the industry.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: MANUFACTURED HOMES REMAIN AN ATTACTIVE OPTION
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Since manufactured homes tend to be a relatively inexpensive housing option, they offer a solution to some facing the affordable housing crisis in the United States.

industry_definition: The Manufactured Home Wholesaling industry wholesales manufactured homes, other prefabricated buildings and a wide range of construction materials, such as glass products, wire products, plaster products, awnings and ornamental ironwork. The construction materials sold by this industry are generally supplied directly to retailers and construction contractors, while
key_trends: Wholesalers offering a wide array of construction products and manufactured home accessories fare better than wholesalers focusing on a niche pocket of the product space.
Wholesalers within the industry compete primarily based on price, quality, breadth of product selection and customer service.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Professional contractors include residential construction contractors, commercial building contractors, remodelers, and other professionals working in the construction business.

market_segmentation.segment: Other wholesalers and manufactured housing dealers
market_segmentation.segment_description: Wholesalers often act as middlemen between manufacturers and retailers and between manufacturers and distributors, the latter of which maintain the distributional networks that supply retailers. This market segment also includes manufactured housing dealers, who wholesalers supply.

products_and_services.product_description: Demand for prefabricated homes will continue to benefit from new manufacturing technology, which increases the quality, energy efficiency, level of customization and average size of manufactured homes with minimal additional costs.

Advanced glass materials, such as solar glass, which generates solar electricity, and smart glass, which eliminates the need for blinds or drapery through opaque suspended particles, are also more profitable to industry wholesalers than conventional glass materials.

tier_1_suppliers: Metalworking Machinery Manufacturing in the US
Wood Product Manufacturing in the US
Prefabricated Home Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Iron Ore Mining in the US
Glass Product Manufacturing in the US
Steel Rolling & Drawing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Lumber & Building Material Stores in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Home improvement stores drive demand for construction materials, such as glass and wire products, by retailing them to do-it-yourself consumers. As the level of home improvement activity increases, so does demand for products from home improvement stores.

Most industry-relevant products are ancillary construction materials, and developments in niche markets mainly covered by nonresidential construction contribute to significant demand for industry products.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region houses the most significant number of industry establishments. Within this region, Florida represents the largest hub for manufactured home wholesalers.
The West accounts for the second most significant share of manufactured home wholesaling industry establishments, only trailing behind the Southeast.

regulations_points.regulation_title: National Manufactured Housing Construction and Safety Standards Act
regulations_points.regulation_description: By contrast, wholesalers of mobile homes and other prefabricated buildings are subject to a wider range of building standards and environmental compliance codes.

basis_points.basis_description: Wholesalers offering a wide array of construction products and manufactured home accessories fare better than wholesalers focusing on a niche pocket of the product space.
Wholesalers within the industry compete primarily based on price, quality, breadth of product selection and customer service.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The Manufactured Home Wholesaling industry is highly fragmented.
The industry has a low concentration of ownership.

top_companies.company_name: American Builders & Contractors Supply Co Inc.

FAQs.question: How does your firm adjust its marketing during poor economic conditions?
FAQs.answer: Wholesalers of manufactured homes and other goods emphasize the quality of the products they wholesale during times of economic downturn.
